intro: Hieracium ecuadorense, commonly known as the Ecuadorian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountainous regions. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer seasons. Hieracium ecuadorense is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its native habitat.
